extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: Butter or oil for greasing pan

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla extract
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 - 3 teaspoons vanilla extract (depending on flavor preference)

recipes.title: Cinnamon Vanilla Crepes

winePairing.pairingText: Bordeaux, White Burgundy, and Champagne are my top picks for French. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. You could try Terra Blanca "ONYX" Mountain Bordeaux Blend. Reviewers quite like it with a 4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 103 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Terra Blanca "ONYX" Mountain Bordeaux Blend
productMatches.description: Raspberry and cherry with notes of violets lift from the glass and mingle with soft spice and toasted oak on the nose. Smooth, lush flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis wrap around a core of full, yet soft, structured tannins. Cedar notes with light touches of spice fold into lingering cherry and berry flavors surrounded by a sea of rich chocolate on the palate.

recipes.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until well mixed.Grease pan.Pour a small amount of batter (I used 3-4 Tablespoons at a time) into a saute pan over medium heat.Pick up the pan and swirl batter so it reaches the edges of the pan and forms a thin circle.After 30 seconds, gently use a spatula to lift up one edge and flip over.Cook another 30 seconds and remove from pan.Repeat with remaining batter.Roll or fold crepes on a plate until all are made.

steps.step: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until well mixed.Grease pan.

Pour a small amount of batter (I used 3-4 Tablespoons at a time) into a saute pan over medium heat.Pick up the pan and swirl batter so it reaches the edges of the pan and forms a thin circle.After 30 seconds, gently use a spatula to lift up one edge and flip over.Cook another 30 seconds and remove from pan.Repeat with remaining batter.
Roll or fold crepes on a plate until all are made.
